comments:
Build: 20020529

I got the included walkback after attempting to build my plugin jars a second 
time.  I can't reproduce it, but I zipped up my workspace and here's what I did.  The workspace is 
~65M, available on request.

1. Right clicked my plugin's plugin.xml and selected "Create 
Plug-in Jars".
2. In the Ant dialog I selected 
  build.jars
  build.sources
  build.zips
  
zip.plugin
3. I clicked Finish, and Ant ran to completion
4. I right clicked on the build.xml 
and selected "Run Ant..."
5. In the Ant dialog I selected
  clean
6. I clicked Finish, and Ant 
ran to completion
7. I did some Java edits, saves, build etc
8. I right clicked on the build.xml 
and selected 
  build.jars
  build.sources
  build.zips
  zip.plugin
9. I clicked Finish, 
and the Ant console came but, but it had cheese in it.  This is when I saw the walkback appear in the 
log.

This one is similar to others we've seen, but the steps don't include closing 
the console first, which I think the others do.

Jed, step 9 seems to indicate that you closed the Log Console somewhere between 
steps 6 and 9. Is this the case?
Yes, now that you mention it I believe I did close the console between steps 8 & 9.

Are you sure you were using build 20020529? The stack trace is identical to the 
stack trace of a bug that was fixed for build 20020529. 

When the log console was closed and then shown again when it already contains 
output, it showed up with cheese and the same stack trace (see bug 17005).
I am absolutely positive that I was using 20020529.

Jed, have this error happened again since you logged the PR? I have not been 
able to reproduce it. Please try to cause it to occur again in F2.
I haven't seen this lately, but I haven't been running Ant.

Ryan, please try reproducing this using the workspace Jed says he zipped up.
Use can use ftp on ott4f to transfer it.

I don't believe my workspace will help.  I tried unzipping it and following my steps, and have not 
been able to reproduce the bug.  I suggest closing for now, if I reencounter this bug we can reopen.
